titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Rice University Office of Resource Development, Corporate and Foundation Relations photographs, 2000 UA 133
titlestmt.author: Cynthia Schumacher

note.p: Stored off-site at the Library Service Center. Please request this material via woodson@rice.edu or call 713-348-2586.

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.corpname: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

did.unittitle: Rice University Office of Resource Development, Corporate and Foundation Relations photographs

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Rice University Office of Resource Development

did.abstract: This collection includes photographs from the Office of Resource Development's 2000 fundraising events.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Rice University Office of Resource Development is responsible for obtaining gifts and grants from alumni, corporations, foundations and other university friends and supporters to further the academic and research goals of Rice University. This office, in conjunction with the Office of Corporate and Foundation Relations, hosts several fundraising events each year as part of their resource development program.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection includes photographs from the Office of Resource Development's 2000 fundraising campaign, including the Associates Gala at the Junior League Houston, the Associates Dinner, Keck Hall rededication and the Capital Campaign (Faculty and Staff).

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Permission to publish material from the Rice University Office of Resource Development, Corporate and Foundation Relations photographs, 2000 must be obtained from the Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This material is open for research.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Stored off-site at the Library Service Center. Please request this material via woodson@rice.edu or call 713-348-2586.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: This collection was transferred by the Rice University Office of Resource Development, 2010.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Rice University Office of Resource Development, Corporate and Foundation Relations photographs, 2000, UA 133 Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: See also Rice University Development Office Fund Council records, 1971-2002 and Rice University Development Office $33 Million Campaign, 1965-1969.
